definition[0]: if something such as power, influence, or a feeling wanes, it becomes gradually less strong or less important
example[0]: My enthusiasm for the project was waning.
example[1]: The groupâ€™s influence had begun to wane by this time.
definition[1]: when the moon wanes, you gradually see less of it
definition[2]: if something such as influence, interest, or power wanes, it gradually becomes less strong
example[2]: Trading activity quickly waned after the initial flurry, leaving prices stuck at the lower levels.
example[3]: There was some evidence that inflation was waning.
definition[3]: becoming smaller, weaker, or less important
example[4]: The positive signs are that economic growth is steady and unemployment is on the wane.
